statement.tex: \text{Find the slope of the tangent to the curve}\\ \quad y=\dfrac{x-1}{x-2},x\neq 2\text{ at }x = 10.

step.context: \text{Is the following the correct formula for}\\ \quad \dfrac{d}{dx}\dfrac{f(x)}{g(x)}?
step.reason: \text{This is a standard result. Review if you}\\ \text{got it wrong.}
\text{Apply the standard result from Step #1 with }x=10.

step.tex: \text{No. y is not even continuous at }x=2.\\ \text{How can it be differentiable?}
step.reason: \text{If a function is not continuous at a point, then}\\ \text{it cannot be differentiable there. And y is not}\\ \text{continuous at }x=2\left(\lim_{x\to 2^-}y\neq\lim_{x\to 2^+}y\right).
